title: Brazil international Felipe Melo needs THIRTEEN stitches in horror head wound in Palmeiras’ clash with Corinthians
text:
Brazil international Felipe Melo needs THIRTEEN stitches in horror head wound in Palmeiras’ clash with Corinthians 
Former Galatasaray midfielder clashed with his own team-mate in the 1-0 defeat By Richard Forrester Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments BRAZILIAN star Felipe Melo needed 13 stitches following a horrific collision in a clash between Corinthians and Palmeiras. 
What’s worse is that the horror wound was caused following a clash of heads with his own team-mate Yerry Mina. 3 Felipe Melo suffered this horrific wound following a clash of heads with his own team-mate 
Both players had their eyes only for the ball as they violently collided whilst attempting to win a header as Palmeiras crashed to a 1-0 defeat. 
Unfortunately for Melo, 33, the former Juventus man came off much worse as he was left with a gaping wound above his right eye. 
The midfielder took to Twitter to show off his battle wound and wrote alongside the picture: “I tried to stay in the game after the shock, but it was hurting a lot and I could not see anything.” 
13 stitches later and Melo updated his 1.9 million followers of his nasty looking injury. Former Manchester City manager Roberto Mancini also described him as a ‘warrior’ when the duo were both at Galatasaray.
